1.text: Are we again trying to obtain your approval? Or do we need (as some do) letters of recommendation to you or from you?

2.text: You are our letter, written in our hearts, known and read by all!

3.text: It is being revealed that you are a letter of Christ, served by us, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, and not in tablets of stone but in tablets that are hearts of flesh.

4.text: We have such confidence through Christ toward God;

5.text: not that we are competent on our own to claim anything for ourselves; but our competence is from God

6.text: who has made us competent as servants of a new covenant; not of the letter, but of the Spirit. Indeed, the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life!

7.text: However, if the ministry of death, written in stones, came with glory, so much that the children of Israel could not gaze at the face of Moses because of the glory of his face (and this glory was passing away):

8.text: will not the ministry of the Spirit be with much more glory?

9.text: For if the ministry of condemnation has glory, the ministry of righteousness exceeds all the more in glory!

10.text: It is certain that what used to be glorious has not been made glorious in such a manner—that is, by such an overwhelming glory.

11.text: For if what passes away was glorious, how much more glorious is that which remains!

12.text: Since we have such a hope, we use great boldness of speech,

13.text: not as Moses, who put a veil on his face so that the children of Israel would not see the end of what was passing away.

14.text: In this case, their minds were hardened, because to this very day, at the reading of the old covenant, the same veil remains since only in Christ does it pass away.

15.text: Even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart.

16.text: But whenever someone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

17.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

18.text: With unveiled face, beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, we are all being transformed into the same image, from glory to glory, and this is from the Lord, the Spirit.
